thread.title: Penguins lose to Dallas, 4-1 | Hockey
thread.title_full: Penguins lose to Dallas, 4-1 | Hockey | ArcaMax Publishing

author: arcamax.com
title: Penguins lose to Dallas, 4-1 | Hockey
text:
PITTSBURGH -- The Penguins finally cracked Dallas Stars goalie Antti Niemi on Thursday night.
But just once. And it wasn't nearly enough.
The Penguins lost 4-1 to the Stars at Consol Energy Center, two weeks after Niemi and the Stars shut them out on opening night in Dallas. The loss drops the Penguins to 3-4 this season, and improves Dallas to 6-1.
The Penguins welcomed back veteran winger Pascal Dupuis from injury Thursday, came out strong, but trailed by two goals by 15:05 of the first period.
Defenseman Johnny Oduya lifted a shot from the point through traffic at 10:55 that looked as though Penguins goalie Marc-Andre Fleury didn't even see until it was too late.
Then John Klingberg snapped a wrist shot past Fleury on the power play at 15:05 after stickhandling around Dupuis to make it 2-0.
Jason Spezza capitalized on a turnover by David Perron in the second period, and skated in on Fleury to make it 3-0 at 5:07.
Nick Bonino broke Niemi's shutout bid at 11:20 of the second, working to gain the puck down low before wrapping around the front and burying a shot high.
But that was it for the Penguins.
The Stars scored their final goal when Mattias Janmark jammed in a rebound at 13:02 of the second to make it 4-1.
